message.content: This question requires knowledge about the behavior of gases when heated. When a gas is heated, it expands and rises, which is known as ascension. Option (A) is incorrect because melting refers to the change from a solid to a liquid. Option (B) is incorrect because freezing refers to the change from a liquid to a solid. Option (D) is incorrect because cooling refers to the process of losing heat, not gaining heat.

This question requires knowledge about the behavior of gas when it is heated. When gas is heated, its particles gain energy and move faster. As a result, the gas will expand and rise, which is referred to as ascension. Option (A), melting, is incorrect because melting is the process by which a solid changes into a liquid, not related to the behavior of gas. Option (B), freezing, is incorrect because freezing is the process by which a liquid changes into a solid, also not related to the behavior of gas. Option (D), cooling, is incorrect because cooling refers to the process of transferring heat away from an object, not specifically related to the behavior of gas when heated.

Option (D) is incorrect because cooling refers to the reduction of temperature, not the behavior of gas when heated.
